Oh brother...are you kidding us, Snow?
=C2=A0
For what it's worth, the file=
 in question is unmistakable to my ears and DEFINITELY says "South Africa."=
 
=C2=A0
Why can't some=C2=A0people hear these things? I=C2=A0understand no=
w=C2=A0why Frank gets so frustrated at times, especially when people tell=
=C2=A0him (or Steve or anyone, really!) what their files "really" say. 
=C2=
=A0
Further, I don't think people here share their=C2=A0files so that other=
s can (mis)=C2=A0"interpret" their recordings=C2=A0for them! 
=C2=A0
I've s=
een this happen over and over and over again (usually by the same people) a=
nd personally I feel that it's incredibly rude, condescending and totally o=
bnoxious. 
=C2=A0
My two cents, 
J
=C2=A0


--- On Mon, 12/27/10, Urkel23 <=
urkel23@...> wrote:


From: Urkel23 <urkel23@...>

=C2=A0 




Thank you for correcting me, ho=
pefully one day i will have a better ear to hear the communication like you=
 do. 

Maybe Frank and I should give up. He has about 8 years listening to =
box communication and i have about 5, but the newer people are empatically =
telling us what our files really say.

Maybe Frank and I are losing our ear=
 for this.

-Steve
